definition: fire beacon (to give alarm)
beacon fire
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo
the fire of war in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
Kizilgaha fire beacon tower in Kuchar county 庫車|库车, Aksu 阿克蘇地區|阿克苏地区, Xinjiang
pinyin: Ke4 zi1 er3 ga3 ha1 feng1 huo3 tai2

sentences.english: I embarked toward the sixth beacon.
sentences.chinese: 我向着第六个烽火台进发。

sentences.english: About twenty minutes, can climb up the beacon tower.
sentences.chinese: 大约二十分钟，才可以爬上一号烽火台。

sentences.english: I bite the persisted, I finally boarded the eighth beacon.
sentences.chinese: 我咬牙坚持着，我终于登上了第八个烽火台。

sentences.english: Tall beacon tower as a rectangular small castle, tight defense.
sentences.chinese: 高大的烽火台宛如一座长方形的小城堡，防守严密。

sentences.english: Along the wall are watchtowers, where soldiers used to keep watch.
sentences.chinese: 沿着城墙，设有许多烽火台，过去的士兵用来站岗的。

sentences.english: Beacon towers are built to pass military messages.
sentences.chinese: 烽火台的用处在于传递军事信息。

sentences.english: The pavilion was made by grey bricks and was settled up on the old beacon tower.
sentences.chinese: 亭由灰砖砌成，砌在原先的烽火台上。

sentences.english: Great God explained that the flames of love are like their immortality, evildoer.
sentences.chinese: 烽火大神的解释是爱之者欲其永生，妖孽。

sentences.english: It was a long pull along the Great Wall to the beacon tower on the peak.
sentences.chinese: 还要沿着长城爬很长一段路，才能爬到顶峰的烽火台。

sentences.english: The Yangguan Pass is Just a beacon tower now.
sentences.chinese: 阳关现在只是一个烽火台。

sentences.english: Seongnam stone beacon towers built for the military stronghold.
sentences.chinese: 石头城南建烽火台，为军事重镇。

sentences.english: After trying countless different methods to get her to smile, a Minister came up with an idea.
sentences.chinese: 百般招数无效后，有一大臣出主意让周幽王点燃烽火。

sentences.english: If the beacons of Gondor are lit, Rohan must be ready for war.
sentences.chinese: 如果刚多点燃烽火，罗翰国必须随时参战。

definition: smoke signal indicating the presence of hostile forces
fire beacon (used as alarm signal over long distance)
fire beacons on all sides (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
to pursue deer/fig. to vie for supremacy
lit. fire beacons in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
conflagration/the fire of war
bloodbath/carnage
the fire of war in all four directions (idiom); the confusion of war
to burn
frontier fortress
gonfanon/banner
border station/strategic defensive position on frontier
lit. hunting deer in the Central Plain (idiom)/fig. to attempt to seize the throne
to start a prairie fire
weapons/arms/fighting/war
soldiers at the city walls (idiom); fig. at a critical juncture
